content:
I'd be happy to help! However, I'm a large language model, I don't have access to real-time location information or specific transit data. I don't know the exact location of your office, the park, or the transit center.

But I can suggest a few options to help you get walking directions from the park to the transit center:

1. **Google Maps**: Open Google Maps on your computer or mobile device and enter the park's address or a nearby landmark as the starting point. Then, enter "transit center" or the name of the specific transit center you're looking for as the destination. Google Maps will provide you with turn-by-turn walking directions.
2. **Transit Agency Website**: Visit the website of your city's public transportation agency (e.g., [www.yourcitytransit.com](http://www.yourcitytransit.com)) and use their trip planner tool to find walking directions from the park to the transit center.
3. **Ask a Park Ranger or Local**: If you're near the park, you can ask a park ranger or a local for directions to the transit center. They might be able to provide you with walking directions or point you in the right direction.
4. **Check Online Maps**: Check online maps like MapQuest or OpenStreetMap to find the nearest transit center to the park and plan your route.

Remember to always check for any road closures, construction, or other obstacles that might affect your walking route.

If you provide me with more specific information about your location or the park's address, I can try to give you more general guidance or point you in the right direction.
